title: Trypsinogen is split by the enzyme enterokinase

content.question: Trypsinogen is split by the enzyme enterokinase to form an activated molecule of the protease trypsin. Which of the following would confirm that the activation of trypsin is an example of how a positive feedback mechanism can amplify a biological process?

choices.label: The activated trypsin enzyme can use enterokinase as a substrate.
The trypsin produced by the reaction is capable of splitting and activating additional trypsinogen molecules.
If levels of trypsin were to get too high, the trypsin molecules would inhibit the enzyme enterokinase.
Each mRNA molecule that codes for trypsinogen can be translated repeatedly to form many peptide molecules.

content.answer: The trypsin produced by the reaction is capable of splitting and activating additional trypsinogen molecules.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
